Description: Cipher in ECB mode is detected. ECB mode produces the same output for the same input each time which allows an attacker to intercept and replay the data. Further, ECB mode does not provide any integrity checking. See https://find-sec-bugs.github.io/bugs.htm#CIPHER_INTEGRITY.
CWE: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

Description: Use of AES with ECB mode detected. ECB doesn't provide message confidentiality and  is not semantically secure so should not be used. Instead, use a strong, secure cipher: Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS7PADDING"). See https://owasp.org/www-community/Using_the_Java_Cryptographic_Extensions for more information.
CWE: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
